title: Legal aid not merely act of charity but moral duty: CJI Gavai
content: Gavai expressed the need for legal services authorities to conceptualise and execute their efforts with a long-term institutional vision

title: U.P. student dies after setting himself on fire; 3 cops sent to police lines
content: According to the complaint lodged by his family, the accused police personnel were called by the college principal when the victim staged a protest after alleged denial of permission to appear in the exam

title: Seeking advisor alpha
content: It is good to get an expert opinion to keep your physical and emotional health in good stead. Does this argument extend to your financial health too? In this article, we discuss when it is optimal for you to hire an investment advisor and when it is optimal to self-manage your investments.

title: TPA tangle in health insurance
content: India’s healthcare operates in a liberalised, market-driven environment — but the absence of price discipline and uniformity is hurting everyone

title: Congress backed candidates’ sweep DCC Bank polls in Kalaburagi-Yadgir
content: The four candidates elected unopposed are Somasekhar Gonaik, Gurunath Reddy Parvath Reddy, Sidram Reddy Mallikarjun Reddy, and Basavaraj Sanganagouda Patil

title: The torch of American progressive history is being passed to a new generation: Corey Robin on Mamdani’s victory
content: Zohran Mamdani’s win as New York City’s Mayor is a triumph of a kind of democratic action that the country has not seen in a long time, says political theorist Corey Robin; he has made it very clear that the fight against authoritarianism and the fight for affordability are two sides of the same coin, Robin adds

title: BJP confident of winning Jubilee Hills seat, accuses Congress of communal politics
content: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Bandi Sanjay Kumar has alleged that a drug racket, with the support of AIMIM, is targeting minor girls from other faiths and ruining their lives

title: Disruption grows in Uttar Pradesh industrial clusters due to U.S. tariffs as demand for bailout grows louder
content: Amid the crisis opposition Samajwadi Party demanded urgent, targeted government intervention through liquidity, wage support, and new market access to prevent a transitory shock from becoming a prolonged humanitarian and economic crisis in the State.

title: Trinamool Congress continues to blame SIR for unnatural deaths in West Bengal
content: The SIR exercise began on November 4. Between October 28 and November 7, at least 11 deaths—including six by suicide and two suicide attempt—have been highlighted by the Trinamool Congress alleging fear of disenfranchisement through the SIR process.

title: Congress leaders predict massive win in the bypoll
content: Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka described Naveen Yadav as a dedicated social worker and the Congress has given a ticket to a representative from a weaker section

title: Omni bus owners stop operations to Kerala, Karnataka; cite inability to pay road tax
content: Omni bus operators pay road tax and all India permit charges every 90 days, and that amount doubles when they have to pay road tax in other States as well

title: Two persons washed away in Palar river near Arakkonam
content: The deceased were identified as S. Nirmala (40), a wage worker near Vaniyambadi town, and S. Ramesh (40), who works as lab technician at Government Stanley Hospital in Chennai.

title: Applying the Dravidian algorithm to sports
content: The Tamil Nadu government’s focus on sports has resulted in more medals and support for sportspersons and para-sportspersons on and off the field

title: All India tourist permit vehicles to stop services to T.N., Karnataka
content: The decision was forced upon the operators as neighbouring States have begun levying heavy fines, imposing unlawful State-level taxes, and seizing All India Tourist Permit buses belonging to Kerala operators, alleges Luxury Bus Owners’ Association

title: Entries invited from food business operators for State government awards
content: Interested FBOs should submit their applications at the office of the Designated Officer (DO) of FSSAI in Cuddalore on or before November 25.

title: Effective BP control can reduce risk of stroke, say experts
content: Indian Stroke Association experts stress on the need to educate the public on the importance of regular blood pressure monitoring for individuals aged 18 and above

title: Kumily continues to lack essential amenities to host Sabarimala pilgrims
content: Thousands of pilgrims from Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Telangana, and Andhra Pradesh use the Kumily-Mundakkayam-Erumeli-Pampa route to reach the hill shrine

title: I am under threat, my enemies may even get me killed, claims Tej Pratap Yadav
content: The Janshakti Dal chief said, ‘My security has been increased... I am under threat. My enemies may even get me killed. Everyone seems like an enemy.’

title: Assam Cabinet approves Bill to ban polygamy, victims to get compensation
content: Addressing a press conference after a Cabinet meeting, Mr. Sarma said the government will also create a new fund to compensate the victims of polygamy so that they do not face hardship in continuing with their lives.

title: Survey, mapping of KWA pipelines within Kochi Corporation limits begin
content: The topographical survey has begun simultaneously in different Corporation wards, and it will soon be followed by a consumer survey

title: Question paper mix-up hits Manipur civil services exam
content: The Manipur Public Service Commission cancelled two papers of General Studies after candidates received the wrong set

title: Bihar to get young, energetic CM in Tejashwi, says Akhilesh Yadav; cites winds of change
content: Akhilesh Yadav said the RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and INDIA bloc are heading towards victory in Bihar, and their success will further strengthen the alliance nationally after the polls

title: Congress says NDA ‘conceding defeat’ in Bihar Assembly polls
content: Addressing presspersons in Patna, Congress leader Pawan Khera claimed that following the high voter turnout in the first phase and growing public support for the Opposition INDIA bloc ahead of the final phase on November 11, NDA leaders have begun vacating their official residences

title: Bihar Assembly election: Second phase campaign ends, polling in 122 seats on November 11
content: Amit Shah says there is no vacancy for CM post; Rahul Gandhi takes a dig at PM over ‘vote theft’; Tejashwi asks voters for a chance to fulfil his poll promises

title: Along with the BJP, descendants of Bankim Chandra highlight neglect to writer’s house in Kolkata
content: State BJP president Samik Bhattacharya and two descendants of the writer said that the house of Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay on 5, Pratap Chatterjee Street in Kolkata, which was taken over by the West Bengal government, lies in a state of neglect

title: Kochi City police register 30 NDPS cases in special drive
content: Action has been taken against 212 offenders as part of the drive, says District Police Chief (Kochi City)

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill, Gautam Gambhir told to 'sacrifice' one player
content: Dhruv Jurel’s recent form bolsters his case further — he scored 125 against the West Indies in the first Test in October and followed it up with an unbeaten 132 for India A against South Africa A.

title: Bill Gates on foundation’s role; not replacing US aid: ‘That’s not our job’
content: The Gates Foundation has pledged $2.5 billion over five years to advance global women's health, marking a significant increase in their investment. This funding will primarily support research and development for innovations like self-injectable contraceptives and rapid STI diagnostics, aiming to address long-overlooked health disparities and catalyze broader action.

title: Why did BBC director-general Tim Davie resign?
content: BBC Director-General Tim Davie has resigned after 20 years, citing intense demands and admitting to mistakes, including a controversial Trump documentary edit. This departure follows accusations of systemic bias in coverage of the Gaza conflict and transgender issues, placing the BBC's impartiality under scrutiny.

title: Viral pic! Pakistan's Muhammad Shahzad copies Hardik Pandya's iconic celebration
content: Pakistan clinched their sixth Hong Kong Sixes championship this weekend. They overcame Australia in a close semifinal match. A dominant performance in the final saw them defeat Kuwait by 43 runs. Young all-rounder Muhammad Shahzad's celebration after the win drew attention. Pakistan's victory solidifies their status as the most successful team in the tournament's history.

title: Federal agents pepper-spray 1-year-old girl in Chicago— video
content: US Border Patrol agents pepper-sprayed Rafael Veraza and his one-year-old daughter in a Sam's Club parking lot, days after a judge tightened rules on agent use of force. The Department of Homeland Security claims agents faced gunfire and vehicle rammings, but offered no explanation for the spray incident.

title: ‘Anyone can buy Tesla stock right now’: Elon Musk sends open invite
content: Tesla shareholders approved Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package, contingent on ambitious growth targets. Musk must achieve significant milestones in market value, revenue, and profitability, including a $400 billion EBITDA goal, to unlock the full payout. These challenging objectives underscore Musk's commitment to Tesla's future in AI and robotics.

title: Trophy-hunt syndicate busted: Elite ‘safari’ hunts ran from Bhopal; 60+ kills tracked
content: A year after 3 Mumbai youths were arrested with wildlife meat, probe reveals poaching based on southern African game hunts

title: 'Success takes time': Nvidia CEO tells Zuckerberg- here's what he said
content: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.

title: 5 simple habits for longer life, according to top heart surgeon
content: What many overlook is that exercise does more than burn calories, says Dr. London - it fortifies your heart, muscles and bones, and lowers the risk of chronic illnesses such as heart attacks and diabetes. Consistent physical activity makes your body more efficient at using oxygen, tampers down inflammation, and revs up metabolism, all of which help slow aging. It also gives your brain a boost, sharpening memory and focus, and helping prevent cognitive decline

title: Tom Brady reacts as Fox Sports swaps Mark Sanchez for Drew Brees
content: Tom Brady reacts to Drew Brees replacing Mark Sanchez at FOX Sports as the network cuts ties with Sanchez amid his felony case. Brady’s accuracy comment, Brees’ career stats and statements, and FOX’s broadcast shakeup headline a major shift. Full details on Brees’ new role, Sanchez’s exit and what Brady’s reaction means for FOX Sports.

title: Klay Thompson apologizes to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
content: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: Joe Alwyn’s clover photo sparks Swiftie claims of quiet nod to Taylor Swift
content: Swifties believe Joe Alwyn’s Instagram photo featuring a heart-shaped dish with a four-leaf clover was a subtle show of support for Taylor Swift’s $360 million masters buyback deal. Fans linked the clover to Shamrock Capital, interpreting the image as a quiet nod to Swift’s victory, even though Alwyn never addressed it publicly.

title: November 10: Best time today, as per zodiac sign
content: November 10, 2025, falls within the sacred Hindu month of Margashirsha, a period dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Astrologer Vishal Bhardwaj highlights auspicious timings for various zodiac signs on this day, offering guidance for activities ranging from travel and new ventures to personal reflection and relationship building, aiming to align actions with cosmic energies for success and well-being.

title: Cockroaches can worsen indoor air quality and harm your breathing
content: Cockroaches are more than just a nuisance; they significantly degrade indoor air quality by releasing allergens and bacterial toxins, primarily through their droppings. New research reveals these microscopic particles linger in dust and become airborne, exacerbating respiratory issues for allergy and asthma sufferers. Effective pest control dramatically reduces these harmful substances, proving that eliminating cockroaches directly improves your home's air.

title: PM Modi, Shah will be caught for being ‘involved’ in ‘vote chori’: Rahul
content: Rahul Gandhi alleged that the government is being formed through 'vote chori' by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah. He claimed they win elections through fraudulent means and urged voters to prevent vote theft at polling booths to ensure the INDIA bloc forms the next government in Bihar.

title: Arunachal class 10 student dies by ‘suicide’ in hostel washroom
content: A 19-year-old Class XI student, Tato Podo, died by suicide at St Xavier’s International School in Arunachal Pradesh. Discovered in a bolted washroom with a necktie, preliminary investigation and CCTV footage, corroborated by his family, indicated no foul play. The family declined a post-mortem, opting for traditional rites.

title: Can Muslims join RSS? Mohan Bhagwat answers; explains who is 'not allowed' in Sangh
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat stated the organization welcomes individuals from all faiths, including Muslims and Christians, provided they identify as "sons of Bharat Mata" and part of Hindu society. He clarified that the RSS focuses on unity and a shared national identity, not caste or religion, and defended its legal standing as a recognized organization.

title: Paul Tagliabue death: How former NFL commissioner died at 84
content: Former NFL Commissioner Paul Tagliabue, who led the league from 1989 to 2006, passed away at 84 due to heart failure linked to Parkinson's disease. During his tenure, Tagliabue oversaw significant growth, including league expansion, stadium development, and global reach, transforming the NFL into a global powerhouse. He is remembered for his strong leadership and dedication to the sport.

title: Bihar: Gopalganj locals set police vehicle on fire after rumour of biker death in accident; probe on
content: A mob in Gopalganj, Bihar, set a police vehicle ablaze. This happened after rumors circulated that a bike rider had died in an accident. Police stated three youths on a motorcycle swerved to avoid a speeding Scorpio, resulting in an accident. They were hospitalized. Authorities are investigating the accident and will take action against those responsible for the arson.

title: 'Worst president in US history': Trump slams 'sleepy, crooked' Biden
content: Donald Trump declared Joe Biden the "worst President in American history," citing economic decline, border security failures, and a "humiliating" Afghanistan withdrawal. Trump accused Biden of being "dominated by radical handlers" and "weaponising law enforcement" against political opponents, asserting that Biden's perceived weakness emboldened global adversaries.

title: Pune land deal row: Ajit Pawar defends son Parth again; terms charges 'random' accusations
content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar defended his son Parth Pawar against allegations of irregularities in a Pune land deal, calling them "random accusations" ahead of local elections. He stated an inquiry is underway into the sale of government land to a company linked to his son, assuring the truth will emerge soon.

title: 'Exposing corrupt journalists': Trump reacts to BBC boss Tim Davie stepping down
content: Donald Trump thanked The Telegraph for exposing what he called "corrupt journalists" at the BBC following the resignation of Director-General Tim Davie. Trump alleged the BBC doctored his January 6th speech to appear to encourage violence, accusing the broadcaster of trying to influence a US presidential election.

title: Naya Zia moment? Pak's 27th amendment boosts Munir’s 'taj-e-saltanat'; Oppn readies mass protests
content: Pakistan is set to vote on a significant constitutional amendment next week. This proposal seeks to reshape the military's leadership structure and reform the judiciary. Opposition parties are strongly protesting, calling the changes a threat to the constitution. Legal experts are divided on the potential impact of these sweeping reforms.

title: Delhi's Civic Battle Heats Up As BJP And AAP Announce MCD Bypoll Candidates
content: The stage is set for a high-stakes civic showdown in the national capital as both the BJP and the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday unveiled their candidates for the upcoming by-elections to 12 wards of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD).

title: "Planted News": Mukesh Sahani On Reports Of Rift With Grand Alliance
content: Mukesh Sahani, the chief of Vikassheel Insaan Party, today denied reports that he is unhappy with Mahagathbandhan and is about to switch sides and join the NDA.

title: "Health Emergency, Not Blame Game": Delhi Air Pollution Protesters Detained
content: Scores of people staged a protest near India Gate on Sunday, holding placards that read "Smog se Azadi!" and "Breathing is killing me" as Delhi's AQI touched 370.

title: BBC Director-General Resigns Amid Backlash Over Edited Trump Speech
content: The director general of Britain's BBC, Tim Davie, and the chief executive of news, Deborah Turness, have resigned following criticism that a BBC documentary misled viewers by editing a speech by US President Donald Trump.

title: 35-Year-Old Man Murders Wife With Hammer In Front Of Children After Fight
content: A 35-year-old man killed his wife in front of their children using a hammer and a knife in the Bokaro district of Jharkhand in the early hours of Sunday, police said.

title: UP Student, Denied To Sit For Exam Over Fees, Burns Self To Death: Cops
content: A college student, who set himself ablaze after allegedly being denied permission to appear in an examination over non-payment of fees in Budhana town of this district, succumbed to his injuries at a Delhi hospital on Sunday evening, police said.

title: Exclusive: Inside Pak's Secret Unit 'S1' That Trains Terrorists To Attack India
content: A unit called "S1" in Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) has played a big role in exporting terror to India, way back from the Mumbai blasts in 1993 to the recent terror attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: Assam Passes Bill To Ban Polygamy, But With Exceptions
content: The Assam Cabinet has approved a Bill to prohibit polygamy in the state, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced on Sunday after a Cabinet meeting held at Lok Sewa Bhawan in Guwahati.

title: "Congress Created Telangana...": Revanth Reddy Ahead Of Jubilee Hills Bypoll
content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy launched a powerful attack on the previous Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) regime on Sunday.

title: "Hope To Resume Repatriation": UNHCR India Chief On Lankan Refugees
content: The United Nations Refugee Agency is working closely with the Colombo Mission to resume the voluntary repatriation of Sri Lankan refugees.

title: Legal Aid Not Merely Act Of Charity But Moral Duty: Chief Justice BR Gavai
content: CJI BR Gavai said legal aid is not merely an act of charity but a moral duty, and those engaged in the legal aid movement must approach their role with an administrative imagination to ensure the rule of law extends to every corner of the country

title: Taliban 'Concerned' After Being Left Off Guest List From UN Climate Summit
content: The Taliban government expressed its disappointment Sunday that it was not invited to the COP30 conference despite Afghanistan being one of the nations most vulnerable to climate change.

title: 7 Dead, 13 Rescued After Myanmar Migrant Boat Overturns Near Malaysia
content: Rescuers in Malaysia recovered the bodies of seven migrants from Myanmar and found 13 alive from a boat that capsized with dozens aboard, officials said Sunday.

title: Tejas, Rafale Shine Over Brahmaputra During Air Force's Grand Flypast In Assam
content: A grand flypast by Indian Air Force aircraft, including Tejas and Rafale, over the Brahmaputra captivated spectators on Sunday at an air show organised in Guwahati as part of the Force's 93rd anniversary celebrations, an official said.

title: 4 Killed, 11 Injured After Car Fleeing Police Slams Into Bar In US
content: A speeding car fleeing police slammed into a crowded bar early Saturday, killing four people and injuring 11 in a historic district of Tampa, Florida, that is known for its nightlife and tourists.

title: Decade After Paris Agreement, Experts Say World Has 'Failed' To Halt Warming
content: The world has changed dramatically in the decade since leaders celebrated a historic climate agreement in Paris a decade ago, but not quite in ways they expected or wanted.

title: Furnace, "I Love You" Text: How Pune Man Tried To Cover Up Wife's Murder
content: In a shocking case from Pune that seemed like the plot of a Bollywood thriller, a man allegedly murdered his wife last month, burned her body in a makeshift furnace and then repeatedly visited the police station to mislead investigators.

title: Sheikh Hasina Aide's "Clinton-Yunus" Bombshell And A Big Charge Against USAID
content: A humanitarian agency of the US government and the Clinton family were behind the uprising in Bangladesh that led to Sheikh Hasina's ouster in 2024, a top aide of the former prime minister has alleged in an interview with Russia Today.

title: Massive X Outage, Users Say Unable To Post Content; Working Now
content: Elon Musk-run X suffered multiple outages in India on Monday, going down for the third time after first experiencing disruptions around 3:30 pm, according to reports. As of now, the platform remains inaccessible for thousands of users.

title: KSRTC’s initiative for visually challenged passengers wins national award
content: KSRTC’s Dhwani Spandana project, a first-of-its-kind initiative for visually impaired passengers received the honour for its work in creating an inclusive and accessible public transport system.

title: Stalin says SIR enumeration form is full of confusion, warns of likely deletion of voters’ names
content: The Chief Minister and DMK president says that it is not clear whether the details sought of the relatives refer to parents, brothers, sisters, husband or wife

title: Minor girl gang-raped after being dragged to school premises in Madhya Pradesh; three held
content: The two accused men have been sent to judicial custody by a court while the minor accused has been sent to a juvenile home.

title: T.N. unit of Congress joins DMK in SC against SIR, terms it ‘de novo citizenship verification process’
content: Both petitions have argued that the SIR exercise compromised the principles of universal adult franchise and free and fair elections

title: Political surprises in the offing in upcoming civic polls to Kochi Corpn.
content: A few prominent leaders are likely to contest as candidates from rival political camps; the political fronts are expected to announce their lists in a couple of days

title: Uneven stretches along metro corridor in Kochi remain a safety concern
content: Stretches of key roads, including Sahodaran Ayyappan Road, M.G. Road, and Banerjee Road, are uneven, with their surfaces near the metro pile caps sinking

title: Malappuram poised to notch hat-trick in State school science fest
content: Having scored 891 points, the district enjoys a hefty lead over the other competitors with just one day of the event remaining

title: NDA’s seat count in Bihar will fall below 100: CPI(ML) Liberation leader
content: The Left leader expressed shock over Prime Minister Narendra Modi's use of words like katta (country-made firearm) during the election campaign

title: Four-year-old girl abducted from railway shed, sexually assaulted in Bengal’s Tarakeshwar; one detained
content: The girl was abducted on Saturday (November 8, 2025) when she was asleep beside her grandmother at the railway shed, officials said

title: Kanaka Durga temple removes encroachments, opens Arjitha Seva centre
content: A temporary prasadam counter and cloakroom have been set up at the site, operating during temple hours, says temple executive officer

title: Nutritious Ippa laddu now available throughout the year
content: The Bheem Bhai Tribal Women’s Cooperative Society, is planning to increase its production and is also looking for a franchise model to sell the products, explained a person associated with the cooperative

title: LSGD identifies new sites for regional sanitary waste incineration facilities in Kerala
content: The proposed plants, each capable of processing 20 tonnes of waste per day, will be established in Kottarakara in Kollam, Muvattupuzha in Ernakulam, Kuttippuram in Malappuram and Kadannappalli in Kannur.

title: PM Modi lauds Bhutanese leadership for welcome accorded to Buddha's relics from India
content: A portion of the holy relics of Lord Buddha from India was enshrined at Thimpu's prominent monastery, Tashichhodzong, considered the seat of Bhutan's highest spiritual and political institutions

title: CBI’s SIT finds TTD received adulterated ghee for over five years
content: Probe reveals Bhole Baba Dairy supplied ₹250-crore worth of spurious ghee without procuring milk; chemicals used to manipulate quality tests, supplies continued even after blacklisting

title: Cyclone Montha floods Veligonda project, restoration work under way
content: Over 36 million cubic feet of water enters tunnels after canal breach; de-watering expected to finish by mid-November

title: Congress defends new flyover projects in Mysuru, hits out at BJP
content: KPCC spokesperson M. Lakshman accuses the BJP of being ‘anti-development’; says Mysuru MP’s opposition to the projects is ‘purely political’

title: Registration not mandatory, we are recognised as a body of individuals: RSS chief
content: When asked whether Muslims and Christians are allowed to join the RSS, Mohan Bhagwat said they were welcome but with one condition: that they should identify themselves as the children of Bharat Mata

title: Special Intensive Revision: Kerala likely to complete  distribution of enumeration forms by November 25
content: By Nov. 9 evening, BLOs had distributed a little over 64.45 lakh enumeration forms in the State, according to the Chief Electoral Officer’s office. This number constitutes 23.14% of the total forms to be distributed.

title: Watch: Bihar: Lalu, Nitish & Tejashwi | Talking Politics
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we take a deep dive into the political dynamics of Bihar — examining the evolving relationships and power plays between Lalu Prasad Yadav, Nitish Kumar and Tejashwi Yadav

title: Koramangala shows the way: Footpaths earn a ‘thumbs up’ in walkability test
content: The walk was part of the Project Walkaluru, a citizen initiative aimed at identifying and celebrating the city’s best pedestrian infrastructure

title: Family of deceased woman alleges medical negligence
content: Shivapriya had delivered a boy at the SAT hospital on October 22. She died on November 9 following post-partum sepsis

title: Transparency must in issues of religious oppression: Supreme Court judge
content: Justice Sanjay Kumar makes the remark while rejecting a plea by the Maharashtra government to review a September verdict on the constitution of an SIT to investigate a case in the backdrop of the Akola communal riots of 2023

title: Teenagers have a ‘Ferrari brain with bicycle brakes’: Expert
content: ‘Parents, apart from being compassionate coaches, should also focus on triade of sleep, nutrition and movement’

title: Sugarcane FRP in Karnataka: Ensuring mills pay what is mandated is a tough task
content: This is owing to the ownership pattern of sugar mills in the State, many of which are owned by powerful political families from across the political spectrum, and the prevailing Central laws

title: Star Wars: Germany, UK say Russia and China are stalking their satellites— space spying explained
content: Germany and the United Kingdom have raised alarms over Russian and Chinese satellite interference, reporting their own assets are being stalked and jammed weekly. These actions pose significant risks to critical military communication and navigation systems, prompting increased investment in space security and a warning from Nato about potential attacks.

title: Pro-Trump desis, caught in MAGA Civil War, flee from GOP
content: MAGA movement's nativist fervor is backfiring on Indian-American conservatives like Dinesh D'Souza and Kash Patel, who face xenophobic attacks from far-right groups. This internal conflict highlights the precarious position of minority allies within a movement built on white Christian nationalism, leading to potential GOP defections.

title: Jubilee Hills bypoll: All arrangements in place with drones and three-tier security to guard polling booths
content: The polling will be held from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., with an additional hour permitted compared to previous elections

title: ‘Where is the outrage?’ Victims of Bihar’s debt crisis ask why their plight is not a poll issue
content: MFC harassment in the name of debt collection have led to suicides and disappearances; without jobs, even the government’s ₹10,000 handout for women in SHGs could get swallowed by the debt cycle

title: Chhattisgarh train accident: investigation confirms train overshot signal in red
content: A fact-finding report comprising senior railway officials drawn from various departments concluded that the accident came under the “Signal Passed At Danger” (SPAD) category.

title: In Dhamdaha, the electoral contest turns into test of loyalty and betrayal
content: It’s a fight between heavyweights as Santosh Kushwaha, who quit the ruling JD(U) to join the RJD, is taking on Minister Lesi Singh of the JD(U), a five-term MLA from Dhamdaha. Ms. Singh is trying to portray Mr. Kushwaha as a ‘betrayer’, while Mr. Kushwaha bets on people’s will for a change.

title: KU Sanskrit HoD booked under SC/ST Act for alleged casteist remarks against research scholar
content: The case was registered after Vijayan accused Vijayakumari of refusing to sign his thesis and making derogatory comments since 2015, which he claims were influenced by her political affiliations.

title: Choose DGP from list sent by UPSC, Palaniswami urges DMK government
content: He alleges that Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has “deliberately appointed a DGP in-charge temporarily so as to delay the appointment of the DGP”, as the UPSC did not recommend junior officers who were likely to act at the behest of the DMK government, since many eligible senior police officers were waiting

title: Legendary NBA player, coach Wilkens dies at 88
content: Lenny Wilkens, a smooth playmaker who was inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame as both a player and a coach, has died. He was 88.

title: Guardians' Clase, Ortiz indicted for pitch rigging
content: Cleveland Guardians pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz have been indicted on a host of charges related to an alleged scheme to rig bets on pitches thrown in MLB games. Ortiz is in custody.

title: Giants' Dart suffers concussion in loss to Bears
content: Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart was ruled out in the fourth quarter against the Bears with a concussion.

title: 'Delusional' Dolphins still believe, blow out Bills
content: The Dolphins snapped a seven-game losing streak against the Bills with a resounding 30-13 victory Sunday.

title: Vikings question Ravens' role in false-start woes
content: Vikings players and coaches offered a variety of explanations for how they could commit eight false-start penalties in Sunday's loss to the Ravens.

title: Mills rallies Texans from 19-point deficit in 4th
content: Davis Mills, making his first start since January 2023, threw for 292 yards and accounted for three TDs as the Texans rallied from a 19-point deficit in the fourth to beat the Jaguars.

title: Trump attends NFL game; presidential 1st since '78
content: Donald Trump became the first sitting president in nearly a half-century to attend a regular-season NFL game, making an appearance at the Washington Commanders' contest against the Detroit Lions on Sunday.

title: 'Nick was with us': Mangold speech inspires Jets
content: Jets coach Aaron Glenn delivered an emotional address to his team about the legacy left by the late Nick Mangold on the eve of their win over the Browns.

title: Best, worst of NFL Week 10: Rams win big, plus late meltdowns by the Jaguars and Giants
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions from each game. Here's what we learned from Week 10.

title: Potential fatal flaws that could sink 26 playoff contenders
content: Can Ohio State run enough? Will Georgia's D show up? What could trip up Indiana? We look at teams' weak spots.

title: Week 10 winners and losers: Taylor, Henderson shine while Jefferson, Darnold struggle
content: Jonathan Taylor and TreVeyon Henderson led the way with big Week 10 performances, while Justin Jefferson and San Darnold were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Henderson steps up for Patriots; injuries take toll
content: TreVeyon Henderson had himself a game with Rhamondre Stevenson out, but injuries put a damper on the day.

title: Man City show their potential by capping big week with signature win over Liverpool
content: In seven days, Man City have beaten Bournemouth, Dortmund, and now Liverpool. Pep Guardiola & Co. are officially back to their best.

title: VAR Review: Why Van Dijk's Liverpool goal was disallowed, Doku penalty
content: Liverpool scored an equalizer against Manchester City. But why was it given offside for a player standing in front of the goalkeeper?

title: Norris continues to quiet his critics with title-worthy win in Brazil
content: Critics have long questioned Lando Norris' mental fortitude. His win in Brazil puts the F1 title within his reach.

title: ⚾ Former MLB star Strawberry pardoned by Trump
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned former MLB great Darryl Strawberry, the 1983 NL Rookie of the Year and an eight-time All-Star, of tax evasion and drug charges dating back to the latter part of his playing career.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Spurs tracking Juventus striker David
content: Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur are poised to make a move for Canada international striker Jonathan David. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 2 SPOs in Kathua dismissed from job for links with terrorists
content:
.

JAMMU: Two special police officers (SPOs) in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kathua district have been dismissed from service for allegedly aiding terrorists in their activities. “SPOs Abdul Latif and Mohammad Abbas have been booked... There is no place for terror sympathizers or anti-national elements in Jammu and Kashmir police,” an official said. Meanwhile, police continued inspections of SIM card vending outlets across Kathua district for the second consecutive day on Sunday. “This initiative aims to strengthen the verification process for new SIM registrations and curb the potential misuse of mobile connectivity,” the official added. Vendors were instructed to maintain accurate records of all transactions and strictly follow procedures for collecting and verifying identity documents such as Aadhaar cards, voter IDs, and other valid proofs. SSP Mohita Sharma said negligence or non-compliance with KYC guidelines could invite strict action, including legal proceedings.

End of Article

title: At 144%, big jump in Somalia tourist arrivals
content: the poor east african country is the only one to register a triple digit growth rate . india had 99.5 lakh FTAs in CY (calendar year) 2024 . the travel industry expects to breach pre-Covid numbers either this year or next year .

title: 2 kids dead as school bus falls 150ft down ghat section in Maharashtra
content:
Representative image

NASHIK: An eight-year-old boy and a 14-year-old girl were killed and more than 30 others injured when the school bus they were travelling in fell more than 150 feet down a ghat section in Maharashtra's Nandurbar district Sunday, reports Santosh Sonawane. Inspector Sarang Navalkar of the local Akkalkuwa police station said the injured students are in the age group of 6 to 17 years. "There were 52 students in the bus at the time of the accident," he said. Students were from an aided ashramshala for tribal students in Jalgaon district and had come home for Diwali vacations. "On Sunday afternoon, the bus arrived to take them back to the ashramshala. The driver, while descending the Amlibari ghat section, lost control at a turning, causing the bus to fall nearly 150 feet into a stream," Navalkar said. Police were in the process of registering an FIR against the bus driver.

End of Article

title: Asia Cup gold medallist kayaker run over by truck
content:
Representative image

BHOPAL: Two Indian Navy kayakers, including an Asia Cup gold medallist, were killed after a speeding truck rammed into their motorcycle and dragged it for nearly 20 metres in Bhopal early Sunday, reports Ramendra Singh. The deceased - chief petty officer Vishnu Raghunathan, 27, and petty officer Ananth Krishnan, 18, both from Kerala - were in Bhopal for a training camp with their naval unit. Raghunathan had won the gold medal in the 1000 m K-2 category at the 2024 Asia Cup in Hong Kong and earlier secured a bronze at an open international championship held in Bhopal in 2019. Rohit Nagar SHO said the accident occurred near Mubarakpur toll plaza between 2.30 am and 3 am. The truck sped away after the collision. Police said toll booth records and CCTV footage are being examined to identify and trace the truck and its driver.

End of Article

title: Woman tries to kill daughter & self, kin link it to Bengal SIR
content: a 27-year-old homemaker in the Hooghly district consumed pesticide . she fed her daughter the pesticide and had it herself in a fit of despair . her family claimed she panicked as she suspected her SIR form would be issued only at the house of her estranged in-laws .

title: 4-year-old raped, dumped in Bengal; kin held
content:
.

TARAKESWAR: A four-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped in her sleep, raped and dumped in a locality in Tarakeswar in Bengal's Hooghly district Saturday. Police arrested one of her close relatives, reports Falguni Banerjee. The child lived with her grandparents. Hours after she went missing, locals allegedly found her gravely injured, bleeding profusely, and crying for help near a drain a few hundred metres from Tarakeswar railway station. She was rushed to hospital where doctors treated her wounds and discharged her.

West Bengal Police Arrest Three in Connection with Durgapur Gang-Rape Case

Her family, however, alleged that the child had been sexually assaulted. Cops then launched an investigation and had the girl readmitted for a medico-legal examination.

End of Article

Himanshi Dhawan is a Senior Editor with The Times of India with 25 years of experience in reporting on politics, social sector, gender and marginalised communities. Her writing spans issues related to human rights violations, and looking at health, education, and livelihoods from a gendered lens. In recognition for her reporting she has received the UNFPA-Population First Laadli award for gender sensitive reporting in 2010-11. She has also been the recipient of the Edward Murrow Fellowship (2007) by the US State Department’s International Visitor Leadership Program.
